result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rashad R Lewis

records.addlTxt:
11:32 AM Defendant Rashad R Lewis in court.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Rashad R Lewis, in custody.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  The State is moving to dismiss and read in cases 22CF267, 22CF236 and 21CF1878 and set over with the sentencing on case 21CF1139.  BTC: 22CF267, 22CF236 and 21CF1878 and set over with the sentencing on case 21CF1139.
Defendant now wishes to waive the PSI on 21CF1139.  Defense motions to waive the PSI.  BTC: Motion denied, the court needs this information.

9:34 AM Defendant Rashad R Lewis in court.  Attorney Michael Robert Barth in court for Rashad R Lewis.  Attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Parties are prepared for trial next week.  The court needs pre-trial filings for 22CF267.  The State has tendered a global offer and the defendant has rejected the offer.  The court will perform a Ludwig hearing on Tuesday afternoon.  BTC: State shall email the court and defense the offer.  Defense requests contact with A.C. State objects.  BTC: Bond modification denied.  
State files a motion to introduce statements in case 22CF267.  Defense requests a Miranda Goodchild on these statements.  Parties believe they can accomplish this after the voir dire.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rashad R Lewis appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael Robert Barth for Rashad R Lewis appeared in court. Court reporter Linda Matoska. Defendant has new charges.  Defense files a speedy trial demand on case 22CF267. 22CF236 and 21CF1878 to track.
Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:22 AM Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rashad R Lewis appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael Robert Barth appeared in court for Rashad R Lewis. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski. 
Defense is requesting a speedy trial on 21CF267. 
Off the record.
Back on the record at 10:42Am, same appearances. 
BTC: Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed on cases 21CF1878, 22CF236, and 22CF267.  Probable cause found;  bound over. Defense counsel needs to file proper speedy demands by end of day.
Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with A.J.C under any circumstances. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

2:12 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rashad R Lewis appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gregory A Holdahl appeared by video for Rashad R Lewis. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 3, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Initial appearance on February 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
